# Triathlon training plans

If you're searching for **triathlon training plans**, this guide gives you a practical framework you can apply immediately.

## Who This Plan Is For
This article is for endurance athletes who want a structured plan with clear progression and practical decision rules.

## Key Training Principles
1. Build with periodization.
2. Keep most work aerobic.
3. Progress volume gradually.
4. Protect recovery and sleep.

## The Training Plan
| Week | Focus | Key Sessions | Weekly Volume |
|---|---|---|---|
| 1 | Base | 1 quality + 1 long + easy support work | 4.5-6.0 hrs |
| 2 | Base | Slight progression + strides | 5.0-6.5 hrs |
| 3 | Build | Tempo/threshold focus | 5.5-7.0 hrs |
| 4 | Deload | Lower volume and lower long session | 4.0-5.0 hrs |
| 5 | Build | Specific endurance | 6.0-7.5 hrs |
| 6 | Build/Peak | Race-specific long work | 6.5-8.0 hrs |
| 7 | Peak | Simulation and sharpening | 7.0-8.5 hrs |
| 8 | Taper | Freshness and confidence | 4.0-5.5 hrs |

## How to Customize the Plan
- Start from your current weekly baseline.
- Keep key sessions separated by easy days.
- Move sessions to match your calendar while preserving intent.

## Common Mistakes
- Too much intensity too early.
- Skipping recovery because workouts feel easy.
- Ignoring fueling practice until race week.
